div.p: This optional attribute of the FOREIGN element, available throughout the textbase, contains the name of the language that foreign word or phrase has been written in. Having such information will allow us to isolate different languages for checking and searching purposes. It has no pre-determined values; you should type in the name of the language that applies to your use of the FOREIGN tag.
If you are not sure of the exact name of the language you are using but have a sense of its general grouping or origin, put that information in the tag.
If you canâ€™t find a name for the language at all, leave the attribute blank.
